responses:
Mens hostel: Men's Hostel consists of four blocks named Sapphire, Emerald, Ruby and Diamond. Out of the four blocks, Sapphire and Emerald have 282 and 284 rooms respectively (26.85 sq.mts carpet area with 4 bedded capacities per each room for both). The total capacity of Sapphire and Emerald are 1128 and 1136 members respectively. Ruby has 24 single bedded (10.25 carpet area per room) and 145 double bedded rooms (17.38 carpet area per room). Diamond has 34 single bedded (10.25 carpet area per room) and 146 double bedded rooms (17.38 carpet area per room). Totally Ruby and Diamond have the capacity of 314 and 324 members respectively. Overall, the four blocks have 915 rooms with 2902 members' capacity.

Ladies hostel: Women's hostel has seven blocks named Ganga, Yamuna, Narmadha, Cauvery, North Bhavani, South Bhavani and Old Bhavani.

Ganga has 124 four bedded rooms and 8 double bedded rooms. Yamuna has 93 four bedded rooms and 6 double bedded rooms. Narmatha is the only block to have the 8 five bedded rooms, 96 four bedded rooms, 16 double bedded rooms and 8 single bedded rooms. Cauvery block has 111 double bedded rooms and 15 single bedded rooms. The North Bhavani and South Bhavani both have the capacity of 64 four bedded rooms, 4 double bedded rooms and four single bedded rooms respectively. Old Bhavani has the speciality of 8 eight bedded rooms, 2 single bedded rooms.

Overall, the seven blocks can accommodate 2199 members in 639 rooms

We also have an emergency contact list that includes local emergency services and key personnel on campus. It's important to familiarize yourself with our emergency procedures and be prepared in case of an emergency. Our college offers internship opportunities for students to gain valuable work experience and develop practical skills in their field of study. Internship requirements and eligibility may vary by program, so it's important to check with the appropriate department or program coordinator for specific details. Some of the benefits of participating in an internship include building professional connections, enhancing your resume, and gaining a deeper understanding of your field. To learn more about internship opportunities and deadlines, please visit our website or contact our career services office.

The Controller of Examinations (COE) is responsible for overseeing all aspects of the examination process at Sona College of Technology. The COE office is responsible for setting exam schedules, enforcing exam rules and regulations, and ensuring the accurate and timely publication of exam results. The COE office also manages the administration of exams, including the preparation of question papers, the allocation of examination halls, and the supervision of exam invigilators. Our COE and staff work diligently to ensure that our examination system is fair, transparent, and efficient. To learn more about the examination process including exam rules and regulations, exam schedules, and results, please visit
Controller of Examinations.

For any inquiries related to examinations at Bannari Amman Institute of Technology (BIT), you can visit the official COE Corner website at https://www.bitsathy.ac.in/coecorner/. The Deputy Controllers of Examinations can also be reached for assistance. Dr. S. Velmurugan, M.E., Ph.D., is available at +91-4295-226352, and Dr. A. Mahesh Kumar, M.C.A., is reachable at +91-4295-226355, and Prof. R. Abinaya can be contacted at 04295-226352.

Bannari Amman Institute of Technology conducts a variety of exams for its undergraduate students to assess their knowledge and skills. The exams can be categorized into internal and external exams. Internal exams at BIT are conducted by the institute itself, while external exams are managed by external agencies. Examples of internal exams at BIT include Skill Tests that evaluate specific technical or practical skills of the students, Placement Assessments that help assess students' readiness for job placements, and Formative Assessments that provide ongoing feedback to students and help in their learning process. External exams, on the other hand, are administered by external agencies and organizations. These exams may vary based on the specific academic programs and disciplines. The combination of internal and external exams ensures that students receive a well-rounded assessment that reflects both their academic performance and practical skills. The various assessment methods at BIT contribute to the overall development of students and prepare them for their future careers.

IEEE, which stands for the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, is a prominent professional organization for individuals in various technical fields. IEEE has various societies that focus on specific technical fields. It facilitates collaboration, knowledge sharing, and the development of technical standards.

The purpose of IEEE is to promote the advancement of technology for the benefit of humanity. It serves as a platform for professionals and students to learn, collaborate, and contribute to technological progress.

IEEE organizes competitions, conferences, and workshops that provide a platform for individuals to showcase their innovative projects and ideas. These events foster learning, networking, and exposure to the latest technological developments.

patterns: what are the special labs available
what is the use of a special lab in BIT
how many special labs are there in BIT
what are the special lab facilities in BIT
responses: Special labs in BIT are advanced facilities that provide students with hands-on experience in real-world scenarios. These labs are equipped with industry-standard tools and technologies to offer practical knowledge and skills. They create a project environment that helps students gain a deeper understanding of their fields and develop problem-solving abilities. The special labs at BIT enable students to work on real-time industry projects, giving them exposure to industrial practices. These labs enhance students' practical skills, offer insights into industry challenges, and promote collaboration on innovative projects. BIT has multiple special labs, each focusing on different domains. These labs offer students a chance to apply theoretical concepts to practical situations and gain industry-relevant expertise. BIT offers a wide range of special lab facilities to its students, covering various fields of study and research. Students can engage in hands-on projects, learn to work as part of a team, and develop valuable skills for their future careers. These special labs contribute to fostering a strong foundation in various domains such as artificial intelligence, virtual reality, data science, blockchain technology, cloud computing, mobile and web application development, and more. The labs provide students with opportunities to collaborate on real-world projects, gain exposure to emerging technologies, and develop solutions for industry challenges. The labs not only focus on theoretical knowledge but also emphasize practical implementation, giving students a competitive edge in the job market. With state-of-the-art facilities and dedicated faculty members, these labs play a crucial role in nurturing innovation, creativity, and critical thinking among students. Students can explore their interests, experiment with cutting-edge tools, and contribute to meaningful research and projects through these specialized labs.

responses: The Web Design and Development Lab at Bannari Amman Institute of Technology was established in June 2022. Its main objective is to provide continuous training to students in the field of Mobile and Web Application Development, offering them a platform to showcase their ideas in national and international competitions. The lab actively promotes research in advancements related to Native, Cross-platform, and Hybrid Mobile apps, as well as Web Applications, fostering a continuous learning environment.
The lab focuses on several areas including Full Stack Web Application Development, Flutter Framework for Cross Platform Development, Graphics Design Technology, and more.

Over the years, the lab has achieved numerous milestones, including being recognized as World Skill District Level Winners and Runners. It has also participated and excelled in international and national competitions.

Some of the noteworthy projects developed in the lab include NEED FOR SERVICE, SMARTGLUGO DEVICE, WEALTH OUT OF WASTE, AQUA BOT MOBILE APP, BIT BUS, BIT APPS, VEHICLE REQUEST, and CONFERENCE WEB PORTAL.

Additionally, the lab has been involved in consultancy projects like FACULTY ACTION PLAN, MACHINE MONITORING WEB APPLICATION, FACILITY MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, INVOICE AND DELIVERY CHALLAN MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.
The lab offers training programs on Mobile App Development using Flutter and World Skill Web Technology.
The lab maintains collaborations with various industries and institutes, enhancing practical learning opportunities for students.
As part of its engagement, the lab has participated in a variety of competitions, including those at the international level.
The lab also offers relevant courses to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of modern web design and development practices.

responses: The Renewable Energy and HVAC Product Development Cell at Bannari Amman Institute of Technology was set up in December 2020. This cell was established to bridge the gap between the skills possessed by fresh graduates and the skills required in the fields of solar energy, wind energy, and HVAC (Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning) industries.
The cell aims to address the skill shortage by providing training and knowledge related to renewable energy and HVAC technologies.
The cell is led by experienced faculty members, including Mr. K B Prakash and Mr. M Chandrasekaran.
One of the main objectives of the cell is to equip students with the necessary skills and knowledge to excel in the solar energy, wind energy, and HVAC industries.
The focus of the cell is on developing hands-on skills in the areas of renewable energy, HVAC systems, refrigeration, and air-conditioning.

Additionally, the cell recognizes the need for a competent and skilled workforce to execute tasks efficiently at installation sites of refrigeration, air-conditioning, and renewable energy harvesting plants.

responses: The Silk Fashion Lab is a fashion-oriented lab of the Department of Fashion Technology at Bannari Amman Institute of Technology.
The lab has three verticals:
1. Separation, identification, and characterization of silk cocoons.
2. Silk cocoon processing and conversion to yarn and fabric.
3. Commercial silk product development - apparel, accessories, made-ups, home furnishing, and hand-crafted items.
The lab is supervised by experienced faculty members, including Ms. Sowmmiya S.

The lab's objectives include enhancing students' understanding of silk processing and fashion technology, promoting innovative ideas in silk-based products, and providing hands-on experience in various aspects of silk cocoon processing and fashion design.

The lab's focus areas cover the entire process of silk-related fashion production, from the identification and characterization of silk cocoons to the development of finished silk products for various applications.

patterns: what are the objectives of BIT Gurugulam
how does BIT Gurugulam benefit students
who designed the framework for BIT Gurugulam
responses:
The benchmarking initiative of BIT Gurugulam has been established for the year 2021. The Gurugulam provides students with hands-on experience in foundation skills under faculty supervision. Through the program, students will get acquainted with professional and technical skills. This program has paved the way for students to learn by discovery, enabled greater student-faculty interaction, and expanded the level of research activity on campus, while also helping to identify and train potential candidates for the industrial culture. The faculty members, trained entirely based on industrial standards comparable to World Skills delivered by companies like Toyota Kirloskar Motor and Lincoln Electric, designed the Framework and Standard Operating Procedures for BIT Gurugulam.
